name: nymphaea-joe-cutak
wildlife-value: Lily pads provide a landing place for thirsty bees, protection for pond life and the shading helps prevent algae growth.
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
flower-description: Floating flowers are very light blue with many petals surrounding a yellow center. They bloom in summer, usually between June to August (although can be as early as May and as long as November!). They are about 4 inches in diameter.
leaf-description: Leaves float on water and are large (bigger than 10 inches in diameter). The look like the shape of a plate and are mostly green with streaks of brown/purple/black or yellow with red highlights.
